intro: Vitex thonneri, commonly known as the velvet tamarind, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the verbena family (Verbenaceae) and is characterized by its woody stems and showy, tubular flowers. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in spikes, followed by small, round fruits containing seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in dry forests and shrublands. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
